subject: Getting Started
content:
Welcome to the AI Cost Estimator! This tool helps you estimate the cost of processing different types of data (text prompts, images, or PDFs) using various AI model providers.

To get started:
1. Specify how much data you have
2. Choose your data type
3. Select the model size and capabilities you need
4. Review the cost estimates from different providers

subject: Data Types
content:
Choose from three data types:

• **Prompts**: Text-based inputs for language models
• **Images**: Visual content for image processing models
• **PDFs**: Document files that need text extraction and processing

Each data type has different pricing models and processing requirements.

subject: Model Sizes
content:
Select the appropriate model size for your needs:

• **Small**: Faster, cheaper, good for simple tasks
• **Medium**: Balanced performance and cost
• **Large**: Most capable, higher cost, best for complex tasks

Larger models generally provide better quality results but cost more to run.

subject: Model Capabilities
content:
Choose the capabilities your model needs:

• **Text Generation**: Create human-like text responses
• **Code Generation**: Generate and debug programming code
• **Analysis**: Analyze and extract insights from data
• **Creative Writing**: Generate creative content like stories or marketing copy
• **Translation**: Translate between different languages

Selecting multiple capabilities may affect pricing and model availability.

subject: Understanding Costs
content:
Costs are calculated based on:

• **Input tokens**: The amount of data you send to the model
• **Output tokens**: The response generated by the model
• **Model tier**: Small, medium, or large model variants
• **Provider**: Different AI providers have different pricing structures

Prices are typically shown per 1,000 tokens (1K tokens ≈ 750 words).
